intro: Crotalaria natalitia var. natalitia, commonly known as Natal spurred crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive spurred petals and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seeds are enclosed in a pod and are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas.
